mnemonic:
cruel [kruəl]
cruelly ['krʊəli]
cruelty ['kru:əlti] - жестокость, безжалостность
***
ЖЕСТОКИЙ он, так как икру|ел. (это) cruel
БЕЗЖАЛОСТНЫЙ икру|ел. (это) cruel
***
БЕЗЖАЛОСТНО икру|ели. (это) cruelly
***
Человека жестокого "cruel"
вызовем на дуэль "duel".
examples: It is difficult to forgive anyone for cruelty.
I stand against all forms of cruelty, especially to children.
He can't stand cruelty to animals of any sort.
Scenes of cruelty set his blood aboil.
Their suspicions egged them to cruelty.
He will not forget those who have been the occasions of cruelty.
His cruelty out-Herods Herod.
Mental cruelty can be grounds for divorce.
The children had suffered cruelty and neglect.
They were accused of wanton cruelty toward animals.
To leave a dog home alone is tantamount to cruelty.
He has no conscience about his cruelty.
The thought of such cruelty sickened her.
There was a hint of cruelty in Brian's smile.
Lord Clarendon says that all manner of cruelty was executed.
Many people are fulminating against the cruelty of blood sports.
There must be something wrong with people who riot in cruelty to animals.
I cannot conceive of such cruelty as to take a child away from its mother.
He was arrested for using a rod on his dogs in violation of the state's animal cruelty laws.
The government of Nero at this moment presented a spectacle of awful cruelty and abysmal degradation.
